definition: to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish

sentences.english: Is one thing she liked the strike, and spare, like a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 就是有一点她挺喜欢罢课，和饶老师一样。

sentences.english: The principal's speech vindicated the teachers' right to go on strike.
sentences.chinese: 校长的讲话为教师的罢课进行了辩护。

sentences.english: The teachers tried to whomp up students' interest in a national student strike.
sentences.chinese: 老师们试图激起学生举行一次全国性罢课。

sentences.english: Education budget cuts prompted Filipino students to stage a strike in public universities.
sentences.chinese: 菲律宾国立大学学生因教育预算删减而发动罢课。

sentences.english: The students went on strike, but not the teachers.
sentences.chinese: 学生举行罢课，但是老师们没有罢教。

sentences.english: The children struck in all the schools there.
sentences.chinese: 那里所有学校的孩子都罢课了。

sentences.english: A total of four universities have decided to boycott classes next week to protest against the proposed education funding cuts.
sentences.chinese: 已有四家大学决定下周罢课，抗议削减大学拨款。

sentences.english: It is not clear yet when the teachers on strike will return to their classrooms.
sentences.chinese: 目前还不清楚罢课的教师何时会回到教室去。

sentences.english: They've also called for student walkouts.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经呼吁学生罢课。

sentences.english: Union strike or not will have 10 meetings a significant impact on the scale.
sentences.chinese: 同盟罢课与否将对10日集会规模产生极大影响。

sentences.english: He was kicked out of school for trying to organize a student strike.
sentences.chinese: 他曾因组织学生罢课而被学校开除。

definition: the Save the Nation Anti-Japanese Protest Movement stemming from the Manchurian railway incident of 18th July 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变
pinyin: Kang4 Ri4 Jiu4 wang2 Yun4 dong4

definition: the school (as a party in a contract, dispute etc)/the school authorities
abbr. for 五卅運動|五卅运动[wu3 sa4 yun4 dong4], The May Thirtieth Movement (1925)
